medical_history.chief_complaint: Widespread erythematous, scaly patches on the glans penis.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient initially presented with several asymptomatic erythematous, scaly patches. After nearly 3 years, widespread erythematous, scaly patches developed on the glans, indicating progression of the condition. A biopsy revealed severe cytologic atypia indicative of squamous cell carcinoma in situ.
medical_history.social_history: Moderate smoker, recreational drinker, and denied use of illicit drugs. The patient had intercourse with at least 14 sexual partners.
